title: How do you manage database consistency when scaling microservices in cloud-native environments?

content:
Database consistency ensures that all data replicas maintain a consistent state during distributed operations. Its importance lies in preventing data conflicts and errors caused by microservice scaling, making it suitable for high-concurrency scenarios such as online transaction systems.

Core management involves distributed transaction strategies like the Saga pattern, combined with an event-driven architecture to achieve eventual consistency. Cross-service operations are handled through asynchronous message passing and compensation mechanisms, influencing design to support scalability and reduce resource contention.

During implementation, event sourcing or the two-phase commit protocol is adopted; middleware such as Apache Kafka is integrated for service decoupling; and monitoring and retry mechanisms are established. It is typical in inventory management scenarios, enhancing system reliability and business fault tolerance.
